Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2010 06:04PM germangal wrote: I just completed my 3rd year on Femara. I too had joint aches when I started, mentioned that to my GP and she suggested I try natural Fish Oil, Omega-3, 1000mg/daily. I checked with onc who said it would be fine. Within a couple of weeks the aches disappeared. I'm fussy about which ones I buy, get them at health center that is run by a licensed naturopath. Might be worth checking with your docs on this.
Posts.Title: Femara - experiences? flachica flachica

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2010 02:12AM germangal wrote: Interesting discussion. Has anyone done this with 401K funds? I resigned from work last year, and am now living off SSDI. Having tax-free access to the money in my 401K would go a long way towards paying property taxes and mortgage until we are able to sell the house & move someplace less expensive. Any words of advice? I'm not Stage 4 - but I do have IBC with its crappy mortality rate... so, please forgive me for posting here, ....
Posts.Title: Accelerated benefits - Have you considered withdrawing? JennGrace vickib

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2010 12:44PM germangal wrote: THanks, Judiii and MJLToday - guess I was thinking about the fact that with SSDI, my income taxes are minimal compared to when I was working (hubby doesn't work either, SSDI is the only income), so supplementing it with small 401K withdrawals won't increase it much ...  as long as there are no penalties as well!  I will check with SS folks and IRS to see how much I can withdraw and still collect, that will let me know how long those funds will last :)  Again, thanks!

Posts.Content: germangal wrote: I wear a compression sleeve most of the time. However, I still have some tingling and strange feeling in the armpit where 11 nodes were removed and where I had extra radiation treatments, especially on days after I have done a fair amount of driving. Treatments ended last July. Is this common? Karen Dx 12/7/2006, IBC, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, 4/11 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2011 05:17PM germangal wrote: okay - not a question about preventing, but what to do AFTER they get you!!!  Last month I got bit and ended up with cellulitis and 10 day dose of antibiotics.  Today, I was outside for 15 minutes, to say goodbye to some guests, and got bit twice in my lymphatic arm. Now I'm freaking out about what to do - I washed the area with hydrogen peroxide, but .... welts are still there!  Suggestions?  Karen in NH (where mosquitoes are our state bird!!)
